meanings.definition: To put in a particular order or position.
meanings.sent1: I will arrange my toys neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She likes to arrange her books by color on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to arrange the acorns in a perfect line.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to arrange themselves in a beautiful pattern in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: He carefully arranged the flowers in a vase to create a lovely bouquet.

meanings.sent1: Let's arrange a meeting for next week to discuss the project.
meanings.sent2: She will arrange all the details for the party this weekend.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to arrange a surprise farewell party for their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The chef would arrange the ingredients like a conductor orchestrating a symphony.
meanings.sent5: He would arrange his schedule to ensure he had time for both work and play.

meanings.definition: To organize or make ready for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: She will arrange the tools in the toolbox for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The team will arrange the equipment before the game starts.
meanings.sent3: The magician would arrange his props backstage before the show.
meanings.sent4: The words seemed to arrange themselves perfectly in his mind before he spoke.
meanings.sent5: He would arrange the ingredients on the counter before starting to cook.
